title: What rock vocalists had the most powerful vocals in terms of loudness, control, consistency, etc., but not necessarily popularity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Terry Reid is infamously the singer Jimmy Page wanted for Led Zeppelin. He was due to support the Rolling Stones & Cream, recommended Robert Plant to Page and the rest is history. He had a falling out with producer Mickie Most in 1969 and couldn’t release anything for a while but … He’s supported the greats, had his songs covered by many of them but never actually been one of them despite being a superlative vocalist. Terry Reid - Wikipedia  Superlungs My Supergirl But now for something different;  We are 138 Some may not see through the schlock horror lyrics and visual presentation of the band but from the outset Glenn Danzig’s voice is the secret weapon of the Misfits. He has good vocal control, a nice deep baritone, vocal projection and a powerful bellow of a voice.  Hollywood Babylon The Misfits may have sold 5m records tops and most of those after the band first disbanded. Danzig is a vocalist who outclasses many in far bigger bands but would the world be a better place? Few have his dark obsessions, a zombie Elvis from an urban swamp, he fits perfectly with the Misfits.

I’m going with…. Graham Bonnet. Most famous for his work with Rainbow.I’ve seen him play live a few times in the last couple of years, and even though he’s around 70 years old now, the guy can sing at incredible volume and with total control. Yes, I’m a fan. Here’s a pic I took at the last one:  And, in the very early 80s…  And one more of mine from the same London gig. Just because I like the picture!
